original: @259a / /rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @259a / /rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya bha ga ba ti pra dzny'a ba ra mi t'a hri da ya /
analyzed: a'arya bha ga ba ti pra dzny'a ba ra mi t'a hri da ya /
translated: Ārya-bhagavatī-prajñāpāramitā-hṛdaya

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags pa bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po; bam po gcig go /
analyzed: 'phags pa bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po; bam po gcig go /
translated: Ārya-bhagavatī-prajñāpāramitā-hṛdaya

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas!

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time.

original: bcom ldan 'das rgyal @259b bo'i khab na bya rgod phung po'i ri la dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun chen po dang thabs cig tu bzhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rgyal @259b bo'i khab na bya rgod phung po'i ri la dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun chen po dang thabs cig tu bzhugs te /
translated: The Blessed One was dwelling on Vulture Peak Mountain in Rājagṛha, together with a great assembly of monks and a great assembly of bodhisattvas.

original: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das zab mo snang ba zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs kyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das zab mo snang ba zhes bya ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs kyi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: At that time, the Blessed One entered the meditative absorption called Appearance of the Profound.

original: yang de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo spyod par rnam par blta zhing /
analyzed: yang de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo spyod par rnam par blta zhing /
translated: At that time, the bodhisattva mahāsattva noble Avalokiteśvara, looking at the profound practice of the perfection of wisdom,

original: phung po lnga po de dag la yang ngo bo nyid kyis stong par rnam par blta'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga po de dag la yang ngo bo nyid kyis stong par rnam par blta'o //
translated: saw that even those five aggregates are empty of intrinsic nature.

original: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then, through the Buddha's power, the venerable Śāradvatīputra said this to the bodhisattva mahāsattva noble Avalokiteśvara:

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Son of good family,

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo'i spyod pa spyad par 'dod pa des ji ltar bslab par bya /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo'i spyod pa spyad par 'dod pa des ji ltar bslab par bya /
translated: if a son or daughter of good family wishes to practice the profound perfection of wisdom, how should they train?

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Ārya Avalokiteśvara said this to the venerable Śāriputra:

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra!

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Any son of a good family or

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo'i spyod pa spyad par 'dod pa des 'di ltar rnam par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang la la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo'i spyod pa spyad par 'dod pa des 'di ltar rnam par blta bar bya ste /
translated: daughter of a good family who wishes to practice the conduct of the profound perfection of wisdom should view it in this way:

original: phung po lnga po de dag kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong par rnam par rjes su blta'o //🔽gzugs stong pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga po de dag kyang ngo bo nyid kyis stong par rnam par rjes su blta'o // gzugs stong pa'o //
translated: They should view those five aggregates also as empty of intrinsic nature.🔽Form is empty.

original: stong pa nyid gzugs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid gzugs so //
translated: Emptiness is form.

original: gzugs las stong pa @260a *//🔽nyid gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs las stong pa @260a *// nyid gzhan ma yin /
translated: Form is not other than emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid las gzugs gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid las gzugs gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Emptiness is not other than form.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnams stong pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rnams stong pa'o //
translated: Similarly, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra!

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid de /
translated: All phenomena are emptiness.

original: mtshan nyid med pa /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa /
translated: They are without defining characteristics.

original: ma skyes pa /
analyzed: ma skyes pa /
translated: They are unborn.

original: ma 'gag pa /🔽dri ma med pa /
analyzed: ma 'gag pa / dri ma med pa /
translated: They do not cease.🔽They are without defilement.

original: dri ma dang bral ba med pa /🔽bri ba med pa /
analyzed: dri ma dang bral ba med pa / bri ba med pa /
translated: They are without separation from defilement.🔽They are without decrease.

original: gang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gang ba med pa'o //
translated: They are without increase.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de lta bas na stong pa nyid la gzugs med /
analyzed: de lta bas na stong pa nyid la gzugs med /
translated: therefore in emptiness there is no form,

original: tshor ba med /
analyzed: tshor ba med /
translated: no feeling,

original: 'du shes med /
analyzed: 'du shes med /
translated: no perception,

original: 'du byed rnams med /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams med /
translated: no formation,

original: rnam par shes pa med /🔽mig med / rna ba med /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med / mig med / rna ba med /
translated: and no consciousness;

original: sna med / lce med; lus med /🔽yid med / gzugs med /🔽sgra med / dri med /
analyzed: sna med / lce med; lus med / yid med / gzugs med / sgra med / dri med /
translated: no eye, no ear, no nose, no tongue, no body, no mind;

original: ro med / reg bya med /🔽chos med do //🔽mig gi khams med cing /
analyzed: ro med / reg bya med / chos med do // mig gi khams med cing /
translated: no form, no sound, no smell, no taste, no texture, no mental object;🔽no eye element and so on up to and including no mind element,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams med pa nas yid kyi khams med cing /🔽yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du yang med do //🔽ma rig pa med cing /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams med pa nas yid kyi khams med cing / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du yang med do // ma rig pa med cing /
translated: no mental object element, and no mind consciousness element;

original: ma rig pa zad pa med pa nas rga shi med cing /
analyzed: ma rig pa zad pa med pa nas rga shi med cing /
translated: no ignorance and no exhaustion of ignorance and so on up to and including no aging and death and no exhaustion of aging and death;🔽no suffering, origin of suffering, cessation of suffering, and path;🔽no wisdom, no attainment, and also no non-attainment.🔽Therefore, Śāriputra, since bodhisattvas have no attainment, they rely on and dwell in the perfection of wisdom.

original: rga shi zad pa'i bar du yang med do; ;sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam med /
analyzed: rga shi zad pa'i bar du yang med do; ;sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam med /
translated: up to the exhaustion of old age and death, there is no suffering, origin, cessation, or path.

original: ye shes med /
analyzed: ye shes med /
translated: There is no wisdom.

original: thob pa med /
analyzed: thob pa med /
translated: There is no attainment.

original: ma thob pa yang med do //
analyzed: ma thob pa yang med do //
translated: There is no non-attainment.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: therefore,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams thob pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas gnas te sems la sgrib pa med pas 'jigs pa med de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams thob pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas gnas te sems la sgrib pa med pas 'jigs pa med de /
translated: the bodhisattvas, relying on the perfection of wisdom, abide without attainment, their minds free from obscurations, fearless,

original: phyin ci log las shin tu 'das nas @260b mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar phyin to //
analyzed: phyin ci log las shin tu 'das nas @260b mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar phyin to //
translated: having completely transcended error, reaching the end of nirvāṇa.

original: dus gsum du rnam par bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: dus gsum du rnam par bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: All the buddhas dwelling in the three times have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment by relying on the perfection of wisdom.

original: de lta bas na /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sngags /
analyzed: de lta bas na / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sngags /
translated: Therefore,🔽the mantra of the perfection of wisdom,

original: rig pa chen po'i sngags /
analyzed: rig pa chen po'i sngags /
translated: the great spell,

original: bla na med pa'i sngags /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i sngags /
translated: the unsurpassed mantra,

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sngags /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sngags /
translated: the mantra that is equal to the unequaled,

original: sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i sngags /
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i sngags /
translated: the mantra that thoroughly pacifies all suffering,

original: mi rdzun pas na /
analyzed: mi rdzun pas na /
translated: since it is not false,

original: bden par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: bden par shes par bya ste /
translated: it should be known as true.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sngags smras pa /🔽tadya tha / ga te ga te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sngags smras pa / tadya tha / ga te ga te /
translated: The mantra of the perfection of wisdom is spoken:

original: pa ra ga te /🔽pa ra sam ga te /
analyzed: pa ra ga te / pa ra sam ga te /
translated: Tadyathā: gate gate pāragate

original: bo dhi sv'ah'a /
analyzed: bo dhi sv'ah'a /
translated: pārasaṃgate bodhi svāhā.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo la de ltar bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo la de ltar bslab par bya'o //
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva should train in the profound perfection of wisdom in that way.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin de las bzhengs te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la legs so //🔽zhes bya ba byin nas legs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin de las bzhengs te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug la legs so // zhes bya ba byin nas legs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One arose from that samādhi and gave his approval to the bodhisattva mahāsattva noble Avalokiteśvara, saying, Excellent!

original: legs so // rigs kyi bu /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: legs so // rigs kyi bu / de de bzhin no //
translated: Excellent, son of noble family!🔽It is so, just as you have said.

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is so, just as you have said.

original: ji ltar khyod kyis bstan pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo la spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar khyod kyis bstan pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo la spyad par bya ste /
translated: As you have taught, I will practice the profound perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang rjes su yi rang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang rjes su yi rang ngo //
translated: The Tathagatas will also rejoice.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug dang / @261a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug dang / @261a *//
translated: When the Blessed One had spoken thus, the Venerable Śāriputra, the Bodhisattva Noble Avalokiteśvara,

original: thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de dag lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yi rang ste bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: thams cad dang ldan pa'i 'khor de dag lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten yi rang ste bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
translated: and the entire assembly, together with the world of gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas, rejoiced and praised the Blessed One's teaching.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo rdzogs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i snying po zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo rdzogs so //
translated: The Blessed One's Mother, the Heart of the Perfection of Wisdom, called the Mahāyāna Sūtra, is completed.

original: rgya gar gyi mkhan po bi ma la mi tra dang / lo ts'a ba dge slong rin chen sdes bsgyur cing /
analyzed: rgya gar gyi mkhan po bi ma la mi tra dang / lo ts'a ba dge slong rin chen sdes bsgyur cing /
translated: Translated by the Indian preceptor Vimalamitra and the Tibetan monk Rinchen-dé.

original: zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba dge blo dang / nam mkha' la sogs pas zhus te gtan la phab pa'o //
analyzed: zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba dge blo dang / nam mkha' la sogs pas zhus te gtan la phab pa'o //
translated: The great translator Zhichen Gelong and Namkha translated and finalized it.
